Posts.Content: Feb 18, 2013 07:52PM SaracVA wrote: I have almost exactly the same diagnosis as you - triple negative at age 39. My MO gave me the same choice. The ACT side effects are supposed to be worse, and we decided on the TC based on the risk of heart damage from the ACT - we felt that far outweighed any differences in effectiveness, which other studies have shown to be negligible. Heart damage from ACT is permanent and untreatable. I'll have 6 TC treatments every 3 weeks. If your MO is good, then if they give you a choice there is no wrong answer.
Posts.Title: TN, High Grade, Invasive DC tumor 1.2cm, Stage 1 at Age 40 yananma SaracVA
